Instances.Output: There once was a young boy who was very curious about the world around him. He wanted to know why things happened the way they did and how everything worked. So, he began to study physics. He read about all of the different forces that act on objects, like gravity. He was fascinated by how gravity could make things fall down, even though they seemed to be pulled up. The boy experimented with different objects to see how gravity affected them. He found that the heavier an object was, the more gravity it had. And the more gravity an object had, the faster it would fall.

Instances.Output: I was always fascinated by planets. I love learning about how they interact with each other. The way they pull and push on each other is just amazing. I once read a story about two planets that were in love. But because of the way they interacted, they were always pulled apart. It was a really sad story. But I like to think that there are happy stories out there too, about planets that find a way to be together despite the odds.

Instances.Output:
Mysterious things have been happening in the small town of Shepherdstown. Strange lights have been appearing in the sky and people have been reporting hearing strange noises. The townspeople are mystified and scared.
The town's sheriff, John, is a man of science and he is determined to get to the bottom of the mystery. He begins to investigate and soon discovers that the strange lights and noises are coming from a nearby physics laboratory.
John goes to the laboratory and speaks to the scientist who runs it. The scientist explains that he is experimenting with electricity and that he is creating electromagnetic waves. He assures John that he is not doing anything dangerous and that the town has nothing to worry about.
The scientist's explanation satisfies John and he goes back to the town to tell the people what he has learned. The townspeople are relieved and the mystery is solved.
